Question: What is the intrinsic nature of these three unwholesome roots?
Answer: They have fifteen things as their intrinsic nature.
Namely, the unwholesome roots of greed and hatred each have five categories in the desire realm, totaling ten things.
The unwholesome root of delusion has four categories in the desire realm and one part that is eliminated by seeing suffering, totaling five things.
Namely, the delusion that is bound to the desire realm and eliminated by seeing the accumulation, cessation, and path of practice is entirely unwholesome and established as an unwholesome root.
The delusion eliminated by seeing suffering has ten kinds.
Namely, the five views, doubt, greed, hatred, and pride, and the independent ignorance as the tenth.
Among them, the eight kinds are unwholesome, so they are established as unwholesome roots.
The ignorance associated with the two views of self and extremes is indeterminate, so it is not an unwholesome root.
Question: Since the ignorance associated with the two views of self and extremes is the cause of all unwholesome dharmas,
why is it not established as an unwholesome root? Answer: If the substance of a dharma is unwholesome and can be the cause of all unwholesome dharmas, it is established as an unwholesome root.
Although the ignorance associated with the two views of self and extremes is the cause of all unwholesome dharmas,
its substance is indeterminate, so it is not an unwholesome root.
For this reason, the three unwholesome roots have fifteen things as their own nature.
The nature has already been explained, and now the reason will be explained.

Question: How do the three unwholesome roots manifest?ğŸ”½Answer: If the mind gives rise to greed, then anger does not arise.

Question: In many places, roots are mentioned.
In some places, it is said that the view of self-existence is a root.
In some places, it is said that the World-Honored One is a root.
In some places, it is said that desire is a root.
In some places, it is said that non-negligence is a root.
In some places, it is said that self-nature is a root.
What is the difference in meaning between these various names of roots?
Answer: Those who say that the view of self-existence is a root rely on the various views.
Because of grasping at self and what belongs to self, the sixty-two views arise and grow.
Those who say that the World-Honored One is a root rely on the Dharma that is spoken.
Only the Buddha is able to speak the various wonderful Dharma gates of defilement, purity, bondage, liberation, transmigration, and cessation, and so forth.
Those who say that desire is a root rely on the accumulation of good dharmas.
Only when there is desire can one accumulate all that is good.
Those who say that non-negligence is a root rely on guarding the good dharmas.
Because of heedfulness, one is able to guard all wholesome dharmas.
Those who are heedless, even if they have wholesome dharmas, will still regress and destroy them.

Why only speak of afflictions as leaks and not speak of karma?
Answer: What should be said but is not said should be known to have other meanings.
Furthermore, karma is indeterminate. It means that there is karma that causes sentient beings to abide in samsara for a long time,
and there is also karma that causes sentient beings to counteract the afflictions of samsara.
Therefore, it is not so. It is only called a leak. Furthermore, because karma takes afflictions as its root.
It means that there is definitely no abandoning of karma without eliminating afflictions.
Therefore, only afflictions are said to be contaminants. Moreover, because karma is drawn by the power of afflictions, only afflictions are said to be contaminants, not karma.
There are those who exhaust afflictions but whose life remains, also due to the remaining power of afflictions.
Just as a lump of mud thrown against a wall, though dry, does not fall, one should know that this is the remaining power of the wet state.
Moreover, one attains parinirvÄá¹‡a by exhausting afflictions, not by exhausting karma. Therefore, karma is not a contaminant.
Because the karma accumulated like a mountain by arhats does not continue in subsequent aggregates and they attain parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Why are the afflictions, etc. of the desire realm, excluding ignorance, established as the contaminant of desire?
Why are the afflictions of the form and formless realms, excluding ignorance, established as the contaminant of existence?
Why is ignorance of the three realms established as the contaminant of ignorance?
It was previously explained that the meaning of remaining is the meaning of contaminant.
The reason sentient beings of the desire realm remain in the desire realm is due to their intention towards desire.
They delight in desire, admire desire, hope for desire, seek desire, search for desire, and indulge in desire.
Therefore, in the desire realm, afflictions except for ignorance are established as the leakage of desire.
The reason sentient beings in the form and formless realms dwell in the form and formless realms is
because they aspire to existence.
They delight in existence, admire existence, hope for existence, seek existence, search for existence, and indulge in existence.
Therefore, in the form and formless realms, afflictions except for ignorance are established as the leakage of existence.
The reason sentient beings in the three realms aspire to desire and existence,
and indulge in desire and existence while dwelling in the three realms, is all due to the power of ignorance.
Therefore, ignorance in the three realms is established as the leakage of ignorance.
Furthermore, although sentient beings in the desire realm also seek existence, they mostly seek desire.
Therefore, in the desire realm, afflictions except for ignorance are established as the leakage of desire.
Sentient beings in the form and formless realms do not seek desire at all, but only seek existence.
There is an explanation.
Although one also seeks desires, one mostly seeks existence.
Therefore, the afflictions of the form and formless realms, except for ignorance, are established as the leakage of existence.
The reason why beings in the three realms mostly seek desires and existence is due to the power of ignorance.
Therefore, the ignorance of the three realms is established as the leakage of ignorance.
Furthermore, if a realm has formation and destruction, the afflictions born in that realm, except for ignorance, are established as the leakage of desire.
If a realm has formation but no destruction, the afflictions born in that realm, except for ignorance, are established as the leakage of existence.

Although the three stages of concentration also have formation and destruction, the fourth stage of concentration and the formless realm have formation but no destruction. Therefore, it is said in general.
If a realm has formation and destruction, and if a realm has formation but no destruction,
beings who abide there are due to the power of ignorance.
Therefore, the ignorance of the three realms is established as the leakage of ignorance.
Others only explain the cause of establishing the leakage of existence.ğŸ”½It means abiding here and seeking existence there.
If one abides there and does not seek existence here,ğŸ”½.
Therefore, in the case of those afflictions, ignorance is excluded and the rest are established as the contaminated [aggregates].
The DÄrá¹£á¹­Äntikas only establish two contaminations:
The contamination of ignorance and the contamination of craving for existence.
This is because they are the fundamental causes of the dependent origination of the two periods [of past and future].
Ignorance is the fundamental cause of the dependent origination of the past period.
Craving for existence is the fundamental cause of the dependent origination of the future period.
Question: How do they explain the three contaminations mentioned in the sÅ«tras?
Answer: They say that craving for existence is of two kinds:
There is the unwholesome and there is the indeterminate.
There is that which has karmic retribution and that which does not have karmic retribution.
There is that which produces two fruits and that which produces one fruit.
There is that which is associated with shamelessness and lack of conscience,
And there is that which is not associated with shamelessness and lack of conscience. The unwholesome ones that have karmic retribution and produce two fruits,
And those that are associated with shamelessness and lack of conscience, are established as the contamination of desire.
By this craving, the other afflictions in the desire realm except for ignorance are also called the contamination of desire.
The indeterminate ones that do not have karmic retribution and produce one fruit,
And those that are not associated with shamelessness and lack of conscience, are established as the contamination of existence.
Because of this craving, the remaining afflictions in the form and formless realms, except for ignorance, are also called contaminated.
Why are the remaining afflictions, except for ignorance, called the desire realm contamination and the existence contamination due to craving?
The answer is: craving is difficult to cut off, difficult to destroy, difficult to transcend, excessive, more excessive, and very excessive.
It can cause distinctions in realms, stages, and categories.
The power of craving gives rise to various afflictions.
And so on, explaining the harmfulness of craving in detail.
Therefore, the remaining afflictions due to craving are given the names of the two contaminations.
Why is ignorance in the three realms separately established as the ignorance contamination?
Venerable PÄrÅ›va said:
The Buddha knows the nature, characteristics, and power of all dharmas without error.
If a dharma is capable of independently establishing a contamination, then it independently establishes a contamination.
If it is not capable of independently establishing a contamination, then it jointly establishes a contamination. Therefore, it should not be questioned.
Furthermore, it has already been said that contamination means the meaning of lingering.
No other affliction lingers in the cycle of birth and death for a long time like ignorance.
Therefore, it is alone called a 'leak'.
The Venerable SubhÅ«ti said:
The Buddha knows that ignorance causes sentient beings to remain in samsara for a long time.
Its power is swift, heavy, and intimate, surpassing other afflictions.
Therefore, it is alone called a 'leak'.
Moreover, because of ignorance, there is craving, anger, and delusion towards knowable objects. Therefore, it is alone called a 'leak'.
Moreover, because of ignorance, sentient beings do not know the past, do not know the future, and do not know the past and future.
They do not know the internal, do not know the external, and do not know the internal and external.
They do not know karma, do not know its fruits, and do not know karma and its fruits.
They do not know good conduct and do not know bad conduct.
They do not know causes and do not know dharmas produced from causes.
They do not know the Three Jewels of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.
They do not know suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path. They do not know good and bad dharmas.
They do not know what is blameworthy and what is not.
They do not know what should be cultivated and what should not be cultivated.
They do not know superiority and inferiority. They do not know what is black and what is white.
Regarding the general and specific dependent origination, the arising of phenomena, and the six sense bases,
there is ignorance, darkness, and delusion where there should be true wisdom and insight.
Therefore, ignorance alone is established as a contaminant.
Furthermore, ignorance is difficult to eliminate and has great faults, so it is established as a contaminant by itself.ğŸ”½Although craving is difficult to eliminate, it does not have great faults.
Although anger has great faults, it is not difficult to eliminate.
Pride and the others have neither, so they are established together as contaminants.
Furthermore, because the sutras say that ignorance is the head of all evils, it is established as a contaminant by itself.
As it is said, because ignorance is the head and the precursor,
it gives rise to innumerable kinds of evil and unwholesome dharmas.
Among them, there is also shamelessness and lack of conscience.
Furthermore, because the substance of ignorance is extremely heavy and its activity is extremely heavy, it is established as a contaminant by itself.
As for the substance being extremely heavy,
it means that it is associated with all afflictions and also has its own independent [form].
As for the activity being extremely heavy,
it means that it performs activity together with all afflictions and also performs activity independently.
Other afflictions and so on are not like this.
Moreover, the sutra says:
Because ignorance is the root of evil destinies, it is established as a separate leakage.
As it is said:
Those who fall into evil destinies in this world and the next,
All have ignorance as their root, and also greed and desire as their cause.
Moreover, the sutra says:
Because ignorance is called the great danger, it is established as a separate leakage.
As a sutra says:
Bhiká¹£us, you should know that the great danger is precisely ignorance.
There is a poisonous insect called great danger. Its body is blind, and the offspring it gives birth to are also blind. If it bites others, it also causes others to become blind.
Ignorance is also like this.
It itself is blind and dark, and causes the associated dharmas to also become blind and dark.
If it arises in the continuum of sentient beings, it also causes them to become blind and dark.
Moreover, ignorance in the three realms gives rise to delusion regarding a single realm,
Namely, the four aggregates of the formless realm. It arises in nine stages, giving rise to delusion regarding a single stage.
It means the four aggregates of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception have nine grades, and one gives rise to delusion regarding one grade.
It means the four aggregates of the lower-lower grade of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, therefore it is independently called a leakage.
Question: The remaining pervasive latent afflictions of other realms and stages should be like ignorance, each independently called a leakage.
Answer: Because ignorance is predominant, it is independently called a leakage.
It means there are nine kinds of pervasive ignorance that take other realms and stages as objects.
They are the seven associated with wrong views, etc., and the two independent ones.
Wrong views, attachment to views, and doubt only have two.
Attachment to precepts and practices has only one, therefore it should not be questioned.
Furthermore, because ignorance is the foremost of all afflictions and universally pervades, it is independently called a leakage.
Foremost means:
Because one is covered by ignorance, one does not delight in, tolerate, or understand the four noble truths.
It is like a hungry person who first encounters coarse food and eats until full.
Later, even if they obtain various delicacies, they do not enjoy them.
Thus, the coarse food of ignorance has long been stored in the mind.
Later, even if one encounters the delicious food of the four truths, one will not find it sweet or enjoyable.
Because of not enjoying it, one then gives rise to doubt.
Thinking, Is this suffering or not suffering?
Up to Is this the path or not the path?
In this way, ignorance leads to the arising of doubt. All doubts can lead to certainty.
If one encounters correct teaching and attains correct certainty,
one will then know there is suffering up to there is the path.
If one encounters false teaching and attains false certainty, one will then think there is no suffering up to no path.
In this way, doubt leads to the arising of wrong views.
They think like this:
If there are no four truths, there is definitely a self and what belongs to the self.
In this way, wrong views lead to the arising of the view of self.
They think again like this:
Is this self and what belongs to the self to be cut off or permanent?
If one sees the continuity of what is grasped as similar, one then thinks it is permanent, which is the view of permanence.
If one sees that what is grasped perishes and is not continuous, one then considers it to be annihilated, which is the view of annihilation.
In this way, the view of the aggregates as real self gives rise to the extreme view.
If one considers any one of these three views to be able to attain purity, liberation, and emancipation, this is the grasping of rules and ritual as supreme.
In this way, the extreme view gives rise to the grasping of rules and ritual as supreme.
One further thinks:
These three views, since they attain purity, liberation, and emancipation, are the most excellent, which is the view of grasping as supreme.
In this way, the grasping of rules and ritual as supreme gives rise to the view of grasping as supreme.
One loves one's own views and is hostile towards the views of others.
One gives rise to pride in measuring one's own and others' views.
In this way, ignorance is the foremost in giving rise to the latent afflictions.
Due to the latent afflictions, ten entanglements are aroused.
The entanglements of anger and jealousy are the outflow of hatred.

The proclivities also lead to the six defilements of the dust.
The dust of malice and resentment is the outflow of hatred.
The dust of vexation is the outflow of the view of grasping at views.
The dust of deceit and arrogance is the outflow of craving.
The dust of flattery is the outflow of the five views.
Thus, ignorance, as the foremost, leads to the arising of entanglements and dust.

As for being universal, it is not that ignorance arises in a single moment.
It is said to be universal because it can take the five categories as objects and be the cause of the five categories, and because it increases in the five categories.
But because ignorance arises in the same category everywhere, it is called universal.
That is, what arises together with the universal proclivities is called universal.
What arises together with the non-universal proclivities is called non-universal.
The same is said for one's own realm, other realms, one's own stage, other stages, contaminated, uncontaminated, conditioned, and unconditioned objects.
It arises together with the afflictions and is combined with them.
Like grease in a ball, like oil in sesame, it is therefore called universal.

As a scripture says:
Because of improper attention,
the defilements of desire, existence, and ignorance

Question: There are so many afflictions that arise,
and so many afflictions that cease.
Because they definitely do not abide after a single moment,
how can it be said that the three defilements increase and expand after arising?
Answer: Because it is said that they gradually increase from the lower, middle, and upper levels.
That is to say, the inferior type, having arisen, becomes a condition for the medium type.
The medium type, having arisen, becomes a condition for the superior type.
Therefore, it is said in this way.
Furthermore, it is said that it increases even more in terms of the immediately preceding condition.
That is to say, the inferior type of defilement, having arisen, becomes the immediately preceding condition for the medium type.
The medium type of defilement, having arisen, becomes the immediately preceding condition for the superior type.
Therefore, it is said in this way.
Furthermore, it is said that it increases even more in terms of the homogeneous and omnipresent causes.
That is to say, the inferior type of defilement, having arisen, becomes two causes for the medium type.
The medium type of defilement, having arisen, becomes two causes for the superior type.
Therefore, it is said in this way.
Furthermore, it is said that it increases even more in terms of taking and giving effects.
That is to say, the inferior type of defilement, having arisen, is able to take and give the effect of the medium type.
The medium type of defilement, having arisen, is able to take and give the effect of the superior type.
Therefore, it is said in this way.
Venerable Vasumitra says this:
It is not that the afflictions increase in number.
Having arisen from them, one does not fall back into the unborn state.
Therefore it is said.
Moreover, having arisen from them, one does not fall back into the future.
Therefore it is said.
Moreover, it is said based on repeated arising.
That is to say, one affliction arises and then gives rise to improper attention.
Not relying on the antidote, a second one arises.
Then a third arises, up to a hundred thousand. Therefore it is said.
Moreover, it is said based on gradual intensity.
That is to say, a lesser affliction arises and then gives rise to improper attention.
Not relying on the antidote, a middling one arises, then a superior one arises, and it gradually increases.
Therefore it is said.
Moreover, it is said based on following the object.
That is to say, following the arising of an affliction in regard to a single object such as form, etc.,

If one gives rise to improper thought and does not rely on the antidote, then they will frequently be presently active.
If one gives rise to proper thought and relies on the antidote, then they will not be presently active.
Therefore, this is said.

This is like using a term for the distant to refer to the near.
